data.title: NVidia Vsync ExceptionInInitializerError
data.body:
Hello, I'm facing a problem, yet solution is very simple...

I have installed nvidia optimus graphics on my system, yet vsync is not supported by nvidia driver, libgdx throwns:

Exception in thread "LWJGL Application" java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError
    at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl.LwjglGraphics.setVSync(LwjglGraphics.java:434)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl.LwjglApplication$1.run(LwjglApplication.java:112)
Caused by: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 0
    at org.lwjgl.opengl.LinuxDisplay.getAvailableDisplayModes(LinuxDisplay.java:954)
    at org.lwjgl.opengl.LinuxDisplay.init(LinuxDisplay.java:738)
    at org.lwjgl.opengl.Display.<clinit>(Display.java:138)
    ... 2 more
AL lib: (EE) alc_cleanup: 1 device not closed

The problem is on this line in LinuxDisplay.java (line 954)

Screen[] resolutions = XRandR.getResolutions(XRandR.getScreenNames()[0]);

You are using 0th element from returned array, unfortunately, on vsync not working platforms it returns null. 

You should check size of returned array.

data.title: Feature: getRotation in MapObject (Tiled Editor)
data.body:
Hi,

I notice that libGDX MapObject (used to interface with Tiled Map Object, see the [Tiled Map Editor](http://www.mapeditor.org/) ) does not have a method `getRotation()`. I also tried something like: `myMapObject.getProperties().get("rotation", String.class)`.

I think it could be easy to add this feature?

For now, I import the rotation in libGDX by copying by hand the _rotation property_ into a _custom property_ named `"myRotation"` (in Tiled).

However, I noticed that libGDX has the position origin of its Objects on the bottom-left corner, while Tiled works with a position origin on the top-left corner.
For now, libGDX do the position translation by removing 1 on the y-axis.

This basic translation won't work if we want to take in account the rotation of Tiled objects.
If we want to correct it, for now, we need to add this vector to our MapObject position:

``` java
float rotation = Float.parseFloat(myMapObj.getProperties().get("myRotation", String.class));
float ysize = myMapObj.getsize().y

Vector2 correctionPos = new Vector2(0 + ysize*MathUtils.cosDeg(-rotation-90),
                                    ysize + ysize*MathUtils.sinDeg(-rotation-90));

myMapObject.getPosition(new Vector2()).add(correctionPos)
```

The +1 in the y-axis of `correctionPos` is to remove the basic translation made by libGDX.
The Cos and Sin of the complementary angle is the general solution to change from a top-left origin system to a bottom-left origin system (Note you need to multiply it by the ysize of your rectangle.). 
Note also that a rotation `r` in Tiled Editor is a rotation of `-r` is libGDX.

So I hope I bring with me every thing to allow an implemetation of the feature :D maybe I should try to do a pull request, but I never tried.

PS: sorry if the feature already exists, I'm maybe on a old version of libGDX :/

EDIT:
I corrected the `correctionPos` vector. I replaced `1 + ysize*MathUtils.sinDeg(-rotation-90))` with `ysize + ysize*MathUtils.sinDeg(-rotation-90))` .

data.title: Fixed up struct accessors after accessors were renamed in RoboVM's cocoatouch bindings
data.body: Fixed up struct accessors after accessors were renamed in RoboVM's cocoatouch bindings. Also added logging of whether the app is running in 32-bit or 64-bit mode. (fixes #2734).

data.title: Adding ability to set line height for BitmapFontData
data.body:
While using BitmapFont I've faced issue that sometimes fonts have too big line height, which makes drawn multiline text a bit ugly. #setLineHeight method gives an easy way to change it, e.g. make smaller, to have a more pretty text drawing result. This could be helpful when generating several fonts from one font file using gdx-freetype extension.

Sorry for any inconveniences I've not a git expert, this is the corrected PR for the same [old PR](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/pull/2695)

data.title: iOS 8 reports wrong real dimensional sizes.
data.body:
I've created a game using your framework (can find it here) 
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.polygonattraction.shorb.android&hl=en

I'm doing the iOS release, everything is working fine apart from a few things. It's extremely blurry on an iPhone 6 and on iPhone 6 & 5 the screen dimensions are reported are wrong, example using Gdx.graphics.getPpcx() returns a size way bigger than a CM which I use for everything (button sizes, characters etc).

On a side note:
the desktop version & the iOS version reports the wrong size for CM's. It only effects the desktop version for 1.5.2

Any ideas?

drawPixmap(): resizing not correct
data.body:
The drawPixmap() overload that resizes the src rect does not yield the correct result. I use the following code to make a pixmap half the original resolution:

Pixmap temp = new Pixmap(pixmap.getWidth() / 2, pixmap.getHeight() / 2, pixmap.getFormat());
temp.drawPixmap(pixmap, 0, 0, pixmap.getWidth(), pixmap.getHeight(), 0, 0, temp.getWidth(), temp.getHeight());

This is the scene with the original images: 
![high](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10283290/5693796/ef527d88-992e-11e4-89d4-b326ca2c89cc.png)

If I resize the images with the code above, the result is the following:
![low](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10283290/5693798/00c9fda2-992f-11e4-9acc-2f2fac4d19a1.png)

If you download both images and switch between them in any image viewer, you can see that the resized objects are moving towards the lower-right corner of the screen. With my sprite sheet animation, the effect is clearly visible, with every animation step, the character moves more to the right.

data.title: Dialog constructor didn't call setSkin() on Table superclass
data.body:
One of the Dialog constructors didn't call `setSkin()` on the Table superclass, resulting in the Table's `skin` property being `null`.

See https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/issues/2727

data.title: Dialog constructor doesn't call setSkin() on Table superclass
IntelliJ: Gradle sync failing after editing build.gradle
data.body:
After making edits to the _build.gradle_ file under IntelliJ IDEA 14.0.2 and libGDX 1.5.2, IntelliJ fails to sync the project and displays the error message `Gradle project sync failed. Basic functionality (e.g. editing, debugging) will not work properly`. The `Try Again` button appears to do nothing - actually, the logs show that any attempted sync crashes instantly:

``` java
2015-01-10 19:09:47,782 [2266406]  ERROR - ellij.project.impl.ProjectImpl - com.android.tools.idea.gradle.project.AndroidGradleProjectComponent@72a56960 
java.lang.AssertionError
    at com.android.tools.idea.gradle.project.PreSyncChecks.attemptToUpdateGradleVersionInWrapper(PreSyncChecks.java:175)
    at com.android.tools.idea.gradle.project.PreSyncChecks.ensureCorrectGradleSettings(PreSyncChecks.java:72)
...
```

[An IntelliJ issue](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/IDEA-134118) exists about this problem: it seems that IntelliJ 14.0.2  still ships with an old Android Gradle tool (0.14.2?), not the new and shiny 1.0.0. From the comments there and the issue status, it appears to be fixed in the yet-to-be IntelliJ 14.0.3.

I could work around this problem by changing the version of the Android Gradle tool in _build.gradle_ from `1.0.0` to `0.14.4` (the sync then proceed to download / downgrade to Gradle 2.1).

I'm not sure this is worth a quick fix in libGDX, since a workaround exists and IntelliJ 14.0.3 is on its way, but I'll let you guys see what's best.  : )

data.title: PixMap.getPixel ignores pixmap updates (GWT)
data.body:
Calling `getPixel` on GWT seems to create a snapshot of the pixmap buffer, causing any subsequent calls to getPixel to ignore any changes to the pixmap, returning stale data.

Understand why it's set up like this to avoid major performance issues, but would be great if there was some way to invalidate the buffer.

data.title: File not found in AssetManager.java for FreetypeFontLoader Asset
data.body:
I get an Exception when loading a FreeTypeFont on 1.5.2 but works fine on 1.4.1 and I cannot update my project to the stable 1.5.2.

> Exception in thread "LWJGL Application" com.badlogic.gdx.utils.GdxRuntimeException: com.badlogic.gdx.utils.GdxRuntimeException: File not found: fonts/OpenSans (Internal)
>     at com.badlogic.gdx.assets.AssetManager.handleTaskError(AssetManager.java:527)
>     at com.badlogic.gdx.assets.AssetManager.update(AssetManager.java:354)
>     at com.badlogic.gdx.assets.AssetManager.finishLoading(AssetManager.java:375)
>     at com.mygdx.game.gdx152test.create(gdx152test.java:25)
>     at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl.LwjglApplication.mainLoop(LwjglApplication.java:136)
>     at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl.LwjglApplication$1.run(LwjglApplication.java:114)
> Caused by: com.badlogic.gdx.utils.GdxRuntimeException: File not found: fonts/OpenSans (Internal)
>     at com.badlogic.gdx.files.FileHandle.read(FileHandle.java:136)
>     at com.badlogic.gdx.files.FileHandle.readBytes(FileHandle.java:222)
>     at com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.freetype.FreeType.newFace(FreeType.java:566)
>     at com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.freetype.FreeTypeFontGenerator.<init>(FreeTypeFontGenerator.java:104)
>     at com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.freetype.FreeTypeFontGeneratorLoader.load(FreeTypeFontGeneratorLoader.java:44)
>     at com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.freetype.FreeTypeFontGeneratorLoader.load(FreeTypeFontGeneratorLoader.java:34)
>     at com.badlogic.gdx.assets.AssetLoadingTask.handleSyncLoader(AssetLoadingTask.java:100)
>     at com.badlogic.gdx.assets.AssetLoadingTask.update(AssetLoadingTask.java:87)
>     at com.badlogic.gdx.assets.AssetManager.updateTask(AssetManager.java:464)
>     at com.badlogic.gdx.assets.AssetManager.update(AssetManager.java:352)
>     ... 4 more

I think is caused by fd262a4 that was a fix for #2465

``` Java
AssetManager assetManager = new AssetManager();
assetManager.setLoader(FreeTypeFontGenerator.class, new FreeTypeFontGeneratorLoader(new InternalFileHandleResolver()));

assetManager.load("fonts/OpenSans.ttf", FreeTypeFontGenerator.class);
assetManager.finishLoading();
```

data.title: useHDPI breaks 'real sizes'
data.body:
There's an issue in 1.5.3 and I know what is it, should be an easy fix.

Basically you've suppled the option to "config.useHDPI = true;" which works perfect except it returns the wrong real dimension sizes.

For example: If I used 'Gdx.graphics.getPpcY()'  (One centimeter in height) it breaks with HDPI on. With HDPI off its working good.

data.title: Update TmxMapLoader.java
data.body:
As per issue https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/issues/2717
Added the tileset.setName(name) in the appropriate place

data.title: Loading TMX Tileset Collections - Lacks Tileset Name
data.body:
In the TMX file xml, the <tileset> tag has a 'name' property.
It loads fine in regular single image Tilesets, but in Collection Tilesets (collection of images) the name property of the Tileset is not loaded.

The line tileset.setName(name); is missing from the code block following the else clause in line 359 of TmxMapLoader.java
